h1. Cyclic Barrier Example
h2. Summary
This example shows using a Cyclic Barrier Terracotta. A [Cyclic Barrier|http://java.sun.com/j2se/1.5.0/docs/api/java/util/concurrent/CyclicBarrier.html] is used as an execution synchronization point, or rendezvous, point across multiple threads.
With Terracotta, a clustered Cyclic Barrier can coordinate threads on a single VM, or across VMs. This demonstration will show coordination across two VMs.
h2. How to run
*Node 1:* {code} $ javac *.java $ start-tc-server & $ dso-java Main Waiting for other node to join... (after other node is started...) Started. {code}
*Node 2:* {code} $ dso-java Main Waiting for other node to join... Started. {code}
